emmylou harris was born in birmingham, alabama on april 2nd, 1947.
during her high school years, emmylou & her family moved to woodbridge, virginia due to her father being a marine corps officer. in 1965, emmylou graduated as her classâ€™ valedictorian. after high school, she planned on being an actress & received a drama scholarship. in 1967, she would drop out of college & focus on pursuing music as a folk singer. around 1970 she moved to moved to washington, d.c. with her parents & daughter due to financial struggles. while in washington, d.c. emmylou gained a following from performing at clubs. yet, she was unconvinced she could make it as a music artist. 
around that same time, gram parsons was looking for a harmony singer. one of gramâ€™s friends heard about emmylou from a conversation her daughterâ€™s babysitter was having. they soon got in contact with emmylou & a year later, he sent her a plane ticket to los angeles, california where she recorded harmony vocals for gramâ€™s debut album g.p. emmylou began to tour with gram & found a love for country music.
In 1973, emmylou returned to the recording studio to make gramâ€™s next album titled grievous angel. only a few weeks later gram passed away due to a heroin overdose. after gramâ€™s passing linda ronstadt, who befriended emmylou around the same time, let emmylou stay at her house while she grieved. emmylou decided to continue with music & carry on the country rock legacy left by gram for her own career. in 1975, she released her first solo album â€œpieces of the skyâ€. the album was a commercial success & sheâ€™d release another album â€œelite hotelâ€ soon after. in 1976, emmylou released her album â€œluxury linerâ€ which was her second number one american country album & her second to make the top twenty in the uk.
around 1979, emmylouâ€™s record label proposed shifting towards country pop, which she didnâ€™t do & instead recorded two traditionally-oriented albums, â€œblue kentucky girlâ€ & â€œroses in the snowâ€.".
